intro: Cyrtandra × poamohoensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian heliconia, is a hybrid plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, banana-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a glossy surface, and it produces small, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored. Cyrtandra × poamohoensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is an important part of the local flora.
